postBodyContent: Men who can‚Äôt cook, clean, or even do their own laundry are not ‚Äúcute‚Äù and ‚Äúin need of a woman to care for them‚Äù. They are spoiled brats so dependent on gender roles that they never bothered to learn the minimal skills to take care of themselves.
get to know our members challenge: favorite rare-pairs - minerva mcgonagall & poppy pomfrey (6/?) - malia

So here are some facts for you to consider:

There is  an estimated 70 billion pounds of food waste in America each year.    25 ‚Äì 40% of food grown, processed and transported in the US will never be consumed. Not from people scraping off that last bite of food into the disposal, but from companies dumping food before it ever gets to market.

On a similar note, there are more vacant houses in the US than there are homeless people. Vacant houses lower the property value of a neighborhood, as do the presence of homeless people. There‚Äôs an easy solution to this.

And you can‚Äôt just tell people ‚Äúget a job.‚Äù Or that ‚Äúwell, people who CAN work, SHOULD work! No Freebies for the Lazies!‚Äù 

Getting a job has 2 problems, actually.  First, while there ARE job openings in the US, companies are struggling to fill them because of the ‚Äúskills gap.‚Äù Potential employees don‚Äôt have the training or education to qualify.  Secondly, an increasing number of jobs are simply being replaced by automation, and this issue is only going to get worse. Transportation (truckers, cab drivers, etc) will be one of the first job markets to completely dry up and it makes up millions of jobs. Uber is already testing self driving cars to replace drivers RIGHT NOW.


There is an abundance of food. There is an abundance of housing. Jobs are getting increasingly hard to find, both because of skill gaps and automation, neither of which are problems that are going to go away. Those are facts.

We know that more mixed economies with strong social safety nets (From universal health care to Basic Income Systems)  can and have been implemented successfully.

The question that WE, as a society, have to ask ourselves is: Are we willing to change our economics to save people‚Äôs lives, or will we continue to let people suffer unnecessarily?

 Do we think laziness is a crime punishable by death?
excuse me while i sing to she sky!

ugh, like there is LITERALLY no canonical evidence for the ~han solo: space womanizer~ head canon. like, when he first meets the ONE female character in the entire series that he interacts with he is GROUCHY and SHOUTY at her, not sauve and dashing. she thinks he is a tool and tells him this multiple times. not really smooth and charming.

he then takes to following her around on Hoth and practically pulling her pigtails asking ‚Äú DO YOU LIKE ME? YES/NO? (PLS SAY YES)‚Äù with hearts in his eyes. (Chewie probably had to throw out like a HALF DOZEN old notebooks that were filled with awful power ballads/poetry/odes to her and ‚ÄúMr. Han Organa‚Äù written in different fonts)

when it comes to the iconic ‚Äòi know‚Äô in response to Leia‚Äôs proclamtion of love, Ford has stated that it‚Äôs out of PURE CONCERN for HER FEELINGS (‚Äúthe point is that I‚Äôm not worried about myself anymore, I‚Äôm worried about her‚Äù - DIRECT QUOTE), it was NOT a ‚Äòboss‚Äô move or ‚Äòso swagtastic it hurts‚Äô it was an apology that he couldn‚Äôt be there for her, it was an attempt to make her smile, to make it hurt less than if he had said the words too and then was forced to leave her. (not that he would have been much help; remember that han solo spends the majority of the 3rd film mostly blind and feeble, unable to take care of himself and generally getting in the way while Leia Gets Shit Done)

when he does say the words, it‚Äôs with the most adoring and awestruck expression. those words are fused with more than just love and respect. he‚Äôs almost HONOURED that he gets to love this badass babe and that she allows him to exist in her orbit.

 AND THEN he loves Leia so much that he‚Äôs willing to step aside so she can be happy with the man he believes she wants. and valuing a woman‚Äôs choices and feelings over your own is not exactly womanizing behaviour - so where did this headcanon come from??

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a prefect? Oh Ronnie! That‚Äôs everyone in the family!‚Äú


‚ÄúWhat are Fred and I? Next door neighbors?‚Äù
